Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in determining applicants were not Convention refugees or persons in need of protection
Decision_Level: Administrative decision by the Refugee Protection Division
Evidence_Type: Evidence of racial slurs, ethnically-motivated violence, economic motivations
Legal_Provision: Section 96 and Section 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evaluation_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution on a Convention ground
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Nexus between harm and Convention ground, mixed motives (economic and racial)
Application_Error: Failure to adequately analyze nexus and consider coexisting economic and racial motivations
Review_Outcome: Case remanded for re-determination by a different Board member
Evidence_Ignored: Evidence suggesting racial motivation alongside economic motives
Legal_Standard: Persecution based on a Convention ground: race, religion, nationality, political opinion, or membership in a particular social group
Decision_Review_Issue: Adequacy of reasoning, procedural fairness, nexus analysis
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, sections related to Convention refugee status and person in need of protection
Cause_of_Refusal: Board found incidents economically motivated; insufficient analysis of racial nexus
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to assess credibility and weight of evidence regarding racial motivation
Procedural_Fairness: Violation due to inadequate reasoning and failure to consider mixed motives
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of Board's decision
Procedural_Issue: Inadequate analysis of nexus and mixed motives
Omission_Type: Failure to consider coexisting racial and economic motivations
